comments:
[Refactoring]: Errors and exceptiosn in log if try to refactor ->Rename a C++ 
Class located in a read only file. The class will not get refactored

Tested with  
Eclipse Platform/Version: 3.0.1.1/Build id: 200409301141
Eclipse C/C++ Development Tools/Version: 2.0.2/Build id: 200409101437

Problem:
If you have your C++ Project Read-Only (or just a .h file being Read-only,  
that contains a class C1 ) if you perform a Refactor ->Rename for this class 
C1, you will get two error messages and exceptions in log (see below the error 
log):

Error Message 1:
Title: 'Refactoring'
Text:
'An exception has been caught while processing the change 'child1.cpp'.
Reason:
 File /CPPProject/<myfile> is read-only.
Click "Undo" to undo all succesfully executed changes. 
Click "Abort" to abort refactoring.'
------------------------------------

Now does not matter if you click on "Undo" or "Abort" button in this first 
Error Dialog, you will get the second error message and exceptions in log:

Error Message 2:
Title: 'Refactoring'
Text:
'Unexpected exception while performing the refactoring. See log for a detailed 
error description.
Reason:
 Unrecoverable error occurred while performing the refactoring.'
----------------------------------

Error log:

Update:

The CDT have exceptions/errors when we refactor a read-only class.   These 
inappropriate messages should be fixed but in the next version.  There is no 
loss of data when doing the refactoring.  Subsequently, in the same workspace 
and instance of CDT, when the class is read-write, the refactor works.
Refactoring now offers to make the file writable.
